Description: Lid of a bone or ivory box in the form of a double disc divided by a deep groove; the upper disc is decorated with lathe-turned parallel lines running around the edge; the lower one (mostly missing) has three holes close together drilled or pierced into the edge; both flat surfaces were polished.
Curator's comments: Object found unregistered in 1974 so date and context are unknown. It may belong to a LBA horizon given the form of the decoration similar to comparable items from Enkomi, Hala Sultan Tekke and Maroni and to the general horizon of the other unregistered objects found with it at the same time which also probably belong to this period.
